description: Assesses cause and effect expository writing

levels.4: Causes are clearly identified with specific details and evidence
levels.2: Causes are mentioned but vague or unsupported
levels.1: Causes are missing or confused with effects

feedback_stems.strength: You clearly identified the causes, especially
feedback_stems.growth: Make causes specific—explain exactly what happened and why

levels.4: Effects are clearly explained with evidence showing the connection to causes
levels.3: Effects are explained and connected to causes
levels.2: Effects are mentioned but the connection to causes is weak
levels.1: Effects are missing or not connected to causes

feedback_stems.strength: You explained the effects clearly, particularly
feedback_stems.growth: Show HOW each cause leads to its effect—make the connection clear

levels.4: Uses cause/effect signal words effectively (because, therefore, as a result, consequently)
levels.2: Few signal words; connections between cause and effect unclear
levels.1: No signal words; reader must guess the relationships

feedback_stems.strength: You used signal words well to show connections, like
feedback_stems.growth: Use words like 'because,' 'as a result,' and 'therefore' to show cause-effect links

levels.4: Information organized logically; easy to follow the chain of causes and effects
levels.3: Organization is clear and follows a logical pattern
levels.2: Organization is somewhat confusing; causes and effects mixed up
levels.1: No clear organization; hard to follow

feedback_stems.growth: Organize clearly—present causes first, then effects, or trace the chain step by step
